boat.name: Rock of Ages
boat.full_description:
'Rock of Ages' was commissioned by one of the many fishermen who moved from Sheringham to Grimsby and was designed and built in Boston, Lincolnshire by Gostelow.

She fished out of Grimsby, crabbing and catching bait for the larger trawlers, along with the 'Preseverance', 'Providence' and 'Unity' (all built by Gostelow) until the 1960s.

She was rebuilt in the 1980s and raced on the Humber by Eric Hammond.

She has been undergoing a major restoration ashore on the River Deben since 2009.
boat.construction_details: Clinker larch on oak, steamed frames, double ender, long keel.
boat.short_description: 'Rock of Ages' is an ex-inshore fishing boat with resemblance to Sheringham Beach Boats and Lifeboats, colloquailly described as a 'Shannocker'.
